lines.text: I confessed.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Faustino the Great. For 20 years he was an organ grinder with a monkey. Then one day the monkey went on strike. He wanted shorter hours and longer bananas.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Look-a, Mr. Lyons, I know you wanna make a good impression, but-a please - don't play better than me.
How long you study music?
Fifteen years.
Fifteen. You know, two more years you could've been a plumber?
we play it allegro pizzicato. That's what-a you call 'em, high-class Carnegie Hall stuff. You know allegro pizzicato?
No.
You know Jimmy Pizzicato?
No.
None of the Pizzicatos, uh?
No.
What DO you know?
I know pistachio.
Pistachio? Ha! We play it!
[shrugs]
[Faustino, wanting to audition for Mike's show of "unknowns," promotes himself as a mind-reader]
I no like-a to brag, but the thing I'm-a most unknown for is-a mind-reading. I give you demonstration. You're thinking of something.

[dubiously]
Right, so far.
You're thinking of a nice juicy steak with a French-a fried-a potatoes.

[far less than impressed]
The exit's over there.
Are you a friend of Mr. Yorkman?

[crossing fingers before him]
Friend? Ha. Max and I are just-a like that - two heads on the same neck.
Ice-a cream. Tootsie-fruitsie ice-a cream.
[singing the song WHO STOLE THE JAM?, Bunny smacks dolls in highchairs]
Mama wants to know who made this mess. Mama's gonna kick some teeth in if you don't confess.
Well, go ahead. Say it.
I wasn't going to say anything.
You don't have to put it into words, baby. It's sticking out of your eyes.
I don't want any sardines. I'm not throwing a bare turkey on the stage.
But, baby! I know it's your birthday, but this is important.
I'm going to cover you with the sardines. That's-a how much I love you. Watch-a my smoke!

Mackinaw, you know I have a full record of the case, and tonight at the opening of the play you MAY have the solution, but when the curtain rises, Madam Egelichi will be in the front box, and sitting next to her will be Count B'ullabaisse - but if you take away the count's silk hat, his opera cloak and his full dress suit you'll have ME, shivering in my underwear.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Hey, that's not my suit you're pulling.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text:
[objecting to being killed with a straight razor]
This'll never do. I got a hide like an elephant. By the way, did you ever try to hide an elephant?
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: You will be dead in five minutes
Huh! For your information, my doctor gave me three years to live, and I don't intend to make a fool out of HIM.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Could you love a heel that's been repaired?
[Sam Grunion tries to follow Madam Egelichi but she halts him at gunpoint]
Oh, no. I'm not gonna follow you and get shot. If I was half-shot I'd follow you.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Come in. Is there anything I can do for you? What a ridiculous statement.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Mr. Grunion. I want you to help me.
I have a little sand left. What seems to be the trouble?
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story

lines.text: Some men are following me.
Really? I can't understand why.
lines.character: Detective Sam Grunion, narrator of the story
